bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Ronald Ross, April 2, 1923

div1.p: Carter writes about the malaria control work in the U.S. and introduces Peterson.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Ronald Ross, April 2, 1923
div1.opener:
Miscl
Ross (Sir Ronald
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
April 2, 1923.
Sir Ronald Ross, K. C. B., K. C. M. G.
London, England.
Dear Sir Ronald:
div1.p:
This is to introduce to you Dr. Edwin Peterson, Medical
Corps, U. S. Navy, who is interested in tropical medicine.

As he is going to London to study, I think I can do him no g
greater favor than to introduce him to yourself, at whose feet I,
myself, would be glad again to sit.

I wonder do you recall the few days you spent with us in
Panama? Indeed, I came near beginning this “Dear Major Ross,”
so well do I remember your visit. It was an inspiration to us.

We have done considerable malaria control work in the U. S.
and are steadily increasing it--not doing as much as we should,
but the rate of increase is increasing and all done is permanent.
No community freed from Anopheles has ever allowed them to return.

During the war many camp sites were in places decidedly mal-
arious, yet with Anopheles production controlled in the camps and
an area roughly a mile to a mile and a quarter beyond their limits,
we got through with a little over 1,000 cases contracted among some
some
-2-2
1,500,000 men in such sites. Your work has borne fruit with us.

LePrince, the long man you met in Panama, and myself, had
charge of this work and we also initiated the malaria work which
is still being done in civil communities. We have been getting,
this past year, extremely good results from the use of Paris green
as a larvacide by ingestion.

I will add that there is a copy of “The Prevention of Malaria”
at every station where we are doing malaria work. Old as it is, this
book contains all the principles needed for the control of that in-
fection.
div1.closer:
Very truly your friend, Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
